'''Lickitung''' ([[List of Japanese Pokémon names|Japanese]]: '''ベロリンガ''' ''Beroringa'') is a {{type|Normal}} {{OBP|Pokémon|species}} introduced in [[Generation I]].

Starting in [[Generation IV]], it [[Evolution|evolve]]s into {{p|Lickilicky}} when [[level]]ed up while knowing {{m|Rollout}}.

==Biology==
Lickitung is a bipedal Pokémon with a round body and a thick, powerful tail. It has soft, pink skin with curved yellow lines on its belly and yellow ring markings on its knees. It has a thumb-like claw on each hand, and a single large nail on each foot. There is a yellow spot on its palms and the soles of its feet. It has beady eyes and a long, prehensile tongue. The tongue is likely connected to its tail, which twitches when the tongue is pulled.

At over 6'6" (2&nbsp;m), Lickitung's tongue is twice as long as its body. Sticky, smelly saliva coats its tongue, which causes a tingling sensation when touched and can cause rashes if not cleaned off. It is used for cleaning, capturing prey, and exploring its environment, though it is questionable if its saliva is clean in the first place. Lickitung remembers things by their texture and taste, although it apparently dislikes sour things. The tongue is both dexterous and powerful enough to lift people, as seen in [[AG122|the anime.]] Lickitung can be found in {{DL|List of Pokémon by habitat|Grassland Pokémon|grassy plains and meadows.}}

==In the anime==
[[File:Participant Lickitung.png|thumb|left|250px|Lickitung in the {{pkmn|anime}}]]
===Major appearances===
====[[Jessie's Lickitung]]====
Lickitung debuted in ''[[EP052|Princess Versus Princess]]''. [[Jessie]] captured it and used in the Princess Festival Tournament against {{an|Misty}}. After defeating [[Ash's Pikachu]] and {{AP|Bulbasaur}} and [[Brock's Vulpix]], it lost to [[Misty's Psyduck]]. Jessie accidentally traded her Lickitung for {{TP|Jessie|Benny's Wobbuffet|Wobbuffet}} in ''[[EP146|Tricks Of The Trade]]''.

====Other====
A Lickitung appeared in [[PK15]].

===Minor appearances===
Multiple Lickitung were among the Pokémon attempting to reach [[Shamouti Island]] in ''[[M02|The Power of One]]'', with some successfully crossing the ocean, and others remaining stranded.

A Lickitung was one of the sick Pokémon in a [[Pokémon Center]] in ''[[EP164|Carrying On!]]''.

A Lickitung appeared in ''[[EP169|Beauty and the Breeder]]'', where it participated in [[Pokémon Beauty Contest|a Pokémon breeding competition]].

A Lickitung appeared in ''[[EP194|Ring Masters]]'' as one of the Pokémon competing in the [[Sumo Conference|Pokémon Sumo Wrestling]].

A Lickitung appeared in ''[[EP228|Extreme Pokémon!]]'', under the ownership of an unnamed {{pkmn|Trainer}}. It was seen participating in the [[Extreme Pokémon Race]].

A Lickitung appeared in a flashback in ''[[DP098|If the Scarf Fits, Wear It!]]'' before [[Evolution|evolving]] into {{p|Lickilicky}}.

A Lickitung appeared in ''[[XY001|Kalos, Where Dreams and Adventures Begin!]]''.

A Lickitung appeared in ''[[XY080|Performing with Fiery Charm!]]'', under the ownership of a [[Pokémon Performer]] participating in the [[Dendemille Town]] [[Pokémon Showcase]]. It reappeared in ''[[XY091|A Performance Pop Quiz!]]'' alongside its Trainer, where they participated in the [[Anistar City]] Showcase; then again in ''[[XY112|Master Class is in Session!]]'', where it was used in the Master Class Showcase in [[Gloire City]]. It appeared once again in ''[[XY113|Performing a Pathway to the Future!]]'', where it was seen watching the same Master Class Pokémon Showcase.

A Lickitung appeared in a flashback in ''[[SM018|A Seasoned Search!]]'', where it was under the ownership of [[Mallow's brother]].

A Lickitung appeared in a photo taken by {{Rotom}} in ''[[SM042|Alola, Kanto!]]''.

==In the manga==
[[File:Kit Lickitung.png|thumb|150px|Lickitung in [[Pokémon Adventures]]]]
===In the Pokémon Adventures manga===
{{main|Kit}}
Lickitung first appeared in ''[[PS013|Sigh for Psyduck]]'' as corpses used by [[Koga]]'s {{p|Gastly}}.

Lickitung wouldn't officially debut until ''[[PS091|Murkrow Row]]'', where it's one of the Pokémon seen in {{adv|Gold}}'s house.

Later, in ''[[PS141|Hello, Lickitung]]'', a quad of Lickitung becomes attracted by the scent of {{adv|Crystal}}'s newly evolved [[Megaree|Bayleef]].

In ''[[PS179|The Last Battle XIII]]'' a Lickitung was one of the Pokémon sent to help the fight in [[Ilex Forest]].

A Lickitung was also seen briefly in ''[[PS275|A Vicious Cycle of Possibilities]]'', under the ownership of a {{tc|Biker}} whose gang attempted to ransack [[Three Island]].

In ''[[PS390|Licking Lickitung]]'', {{adv|Diamond}}'s map was stolen by a Lickitung and he attempts to capture it, but instead it evolved into a Lickilicky and provided him a challenge.

In ''[[PS442|Out-Odding Oddish]]'', a Lickitung appeared in the [[Pokéathlon]].

===In the Pokémon Pocket Monsters manga===
{{OBP|Giovanni|Pocket Monsters}} sent out Lickitung to prevent anyone from winning the contest he hosted on TV in ''[[PM028|Seize the Dream of One Million Yen!!]]''.

==In the TCG==
{{main|Lickitung (TCG)}}

==Other appearances==
===[[Super Smash Bros. Melee]]===
Lickitung is a Pokéfloat. As fighting moves to the left, Lickitung will extend its tongue which must be used as a stepping stone to continue.

==Trivia==<!--

Do not add trivia about Lickitung not learning Lick in Generation I.

-->
* In the [[Pokémon Red and Green beta|Pokémon Red and Blue beta]], Lickitung was originally known as "Tonguetyd".
* Its Red/Blue and LeafGreen Pokédex data compares Lickitung's extensible tongue to that of a {{wp|chameleon}}, a real-world lizard.
* Lickitung was incorrectly referred to as a {{type|Fighting}} Pokémon in the {{game|FireRed and LeafGreen|s}} Prima game guide.
* Lickitung's name was misspelled "Likitung" in the Kanto [[Pokérap]].
* Lickitung was listed in the credits of the N64 game ''Paperboy'' under the heading Special Edition Thanks.

===Origin===
It may have been based on any number of lizards with extending tongues, particularly the {{wp|blue-tongued skink}} or maybe even {{wp|chameleons}}. It also shares traits with {{wp|anteaters}}. Lickitung could also be an ''{{wp|Iguanodon}}'', as it shares its characteristic "thumbs" with it.

====Name origin====
Lickitung is a combination of ''lick'' and a corruption of ''tongue''.

Beroringa may be derived from べろ ''bero'' (tongue), ベロベロ ''berobero'' ({{wp|onomatopoeia}} for licking), and possibly ''ring'' (referring to the patterns on its body) or a corruption of the English word ''[http://www.merriam-webster.com/dictionary/lingua lingua]'' (which refers to a tongue or an organ resembling a tongue). According to {{game|Black and White|s}}'s television program ''PokéQuiz'', "{{tt|Berori|ベロリ}} is the sound of licking in Japanese!"
